intro: Fimbristylis punctata, commonly known as the punctate sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or moist habitats, such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, three-lobed fruits. Fimbristylis punctata is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, contributing to the biodiversity of wetland ecosystems.
